abstract.t: An e-mail message with OpenPGP encryption and/or signature has standard form. However, some mail transport agents damage those forms in transit. A user-friendly mail user agent that encounters such a mangled message may wish to try to process it anyway, despite the message's non-standard structure. This document aims to be a sort of bestiary of common message mangling patterns, along with guidance for implementers for how to cope with messages structured in these common ways.
